REM: This is the pyprocess config file
Most of the config is shared with engine
Most importantly logfile is shared which gets all the logs in one place
Anything added here will override the corresponding engine config value
pyprocess logs are sent to $logdir/$logfile where logdir is defined in
engine/backtester.json and logfile is defined here
If $logfile is null then logs are sent to /dev/null and dropped
If $logfile is tty then logs are sent to /dev/tty and appear on console
If set, pyprocess processes live data and not the historical data
Better way is to leave this unset and use the -l/--live option
See details in config.py
SET THIS TO TRUE IF THERE ARE (FEW) MISSING CANDLES IN A DAY
AngelOne historical data has been seen to have missing candles
Omit days with less than 375x1Min candles
Watch out if it reduces too many days
See details in config.py
DO NOT SET THIS TO TRUE AS IT WILL REMOVE MANY DAYS FROM 1D AGGREGATE
AND WILL REDUCE NUMBER OF STOCKS WE CAN BACKTEST
Candle sizes for which pyprocess must generate aggregate data
*** THIS IS IGNORED IN LIVE MODE ***
1Min candle can be too many which may increase memory utilization of the
backtester and also space and time increase by pyprocess. Use judiciously.
